meanings.definition: Fond of or characterized by joking; humorous or playful.
meanings.sent1: She always has a jocular attitude, making everyone laugh with her jokes.
meanings.sent2: The comedian's jocular nature brightened up the room.
meanings.sent3: His jocular remarks during the meeting lightened the mood and made everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: The jocular atmosphere at the party was contagious, spreading joy to all guests.
meanings.sent5: The jocular banter between friends created a warm and inviting atmosphere.

meanings.definition: Given to jesting; habitually jolly or jocund.
meanings.sent1: The jocular man always had a smile on his face, spreading happiness wherever he went.
meanings.sent2: Her jocular personality made her a favorite among her colleagues.
meanings.sent3: The jocular old man entertained the children with his funny stories.
meanings.sent4: His jocular spirit was like a ray of sunshine on a cloudy day.
meanings.sent5: The jocular laughter of the group echoed through the park, creating a joyful atmosphere.

meanings.definition: Intended or suited to provoke laughter or amusement; humorous.
meanings.sent1: The jocular movie had the audience laughing from start to finish.
meanings.sent2: His jocular remarks never failed to bring a smile to people's faces.
meanings.sent3: The jocular cartoon characters made the children giggle with delight.
meanings.sent4: Her jocular wit was as sharp as a knife, cutting through any tension in the room.
meanings.sent5: The jocular tone of the book made reading it a delightful experience.
